Roots
=====

Square Root
-----------

.. math::  \sqrt 4 

\ or

.. math::  4^{1/2} 

Cube Root
---------

.. math::  \sqrt[3] 27 

\ or

.. math::  27^{1/3} 

N-th Root
---------

.. math::  \sqrt[n] 32 

\ or

.. math::  32^{1/n} 

Important Facts
---------------

1. Any root of 0 is 0.

   .. math::  \sqrt[n] 0 = 0 

2. Any root of 1 is 1.

   .. math::  \sqrt[n] 1 = 1 

3. When we multiply roots, we can separate the roots or combine roots of
   same root-value.

   .. math::  \sqrt a \times \sqrt b = \sqrt {a \times b}

   .. math::  \sqrt {a \times b} = \sqrt a \times \sqrt b

   .. math::  \sqrt [3] a \times \sqrt [3] b = \sqrt [3]{a \times b}

   .. math::  \sqrt [3] {a \times b} = \sqrt [3] a \times \sqrt [3] b

4. When we divide roots, we can separate the roots of same root-value.

   .. math::  \sqrt a \div \sqrt b = \sqrt {a \div b}

   .. math::  \sqrt {a \div b} = \sqrt a \div \sqrt b

   .. math::  \sqrt [3] a \div \sqrt [3] b = \sqrt [3]{a \div b}

   .. math::  \sqrt [3] {a \div b} = \sqrt [3] a \div \sqrt [3] b

5. When we add or subtracting, we DO NOT separate or combine roots.

   .. math::  \sqrt {a+b}

   .. math::  \sqrt {a} + \sqrt b 

   .. math::  \sqrt {a-b}

   .. math::  \sqrt {a} - \sqrt b 

6. To solve roots of roots, we multiply roots.

   .. math::  \sqrt [4] {\sqrt [3] {123}} = \sqrt [12] {123}
